that power line and fly yourself.

1490.text:
So that’s how we can spend more time working
on animal movements.

1495.text:
I mean …
Andy: That’s realistic fallacy, but it’s

1500.text:
Andy: So yeah, great – this is obviously,
like you said, something we talk about a lot.

1506.text:
But it’s very useful and so if you want
to practice these things, just start practicing

1512.text:
and explore and you will probably find a lot
of things.

1515.text:
We also are around to try to teach more different
ways to use these effectively.

1525.text:
If you’ve dismissed them before or if you’ve
gotten stuck with them before or whatever,

1531.text:
Look around YouTube for some videos and get
some inspiration and then try things and start

1535.text:
seeing if there are different ways you could
use them from how you tried to use them before.

1545.text:
And when looking at some of those videos online,
be sure to check out our YouTube channel because

1550.text:
we have quite a few videos on there about
these movements.

1553.text:
So …
Andy: And ours are better than anyone else’s.

1555.text: Ryan: They’re the mostest bestest out there.

1558.text: I think we can end with that.

1561.text:
Ryan: Thanks for listening everybody and we
will catch you next time.
